Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery bird bowl; interior glazed with an added red-white-band; top of lip glazed; exterior: bird facing right, in outline with cross-hatched body; dot to right; two or three bands below.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Also published in Price 1924, 185 Abb. 4 (= Bernand 1970, Pl. 46, 2 [3. o. l.]).
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 115, pl. XXXVI, no. 327.2)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (Nau 14, pl. 3g.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.069)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6003 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
